t: Deuteronomy 33
Moses Blesses the Tribes
This*p is the blessing that Moses the man of God pronounced on the Israelites before his death.
He said: “The*pn Lord*s came from Sinai and*ld dawned over them from Seir; he*ld shone forth from Mount Paran. He*ln came with myriads of holy ones from*ld the south, from his mountain slopes.
Surely*ln it is you who love the people; all*ld the holy ones are in your hand. At*ln your feet they all bow down, and*ld from you receive instruction,
the*ln law that Moses gave us, the*ld possession of the assembly of Jacob.
He*ln was king over Jeshurun when*ld the leaders of the people assembled, along*ld with the tribes of Israel.
“Let*pn Reuben live and not die, nor*ld his people be few.”
And*p this he said about Judah: “Hear,*pn Lord,*s the cry of Judah; bring*ld him to his people. With*ln his own hands he defends his cause. Oh,*ld be his help against his foes!”
About*p Levi he said: “Your*pn Thummim and Urim belong to*ld your faithful servant. You*ln tested him at Massah; you*ld contended with him at the waters of Meribah.

He*ln said of his father and mother, ‘I*ld have no regard for them.’ He*ln did not recognize his brothers or*ld acknowledge his own children, but*ln he watched over your word and*ld guarded your covenant.
He*ln teaches your precepts to Jacob and*ld your law to Israel. He*ln offers incense before you and*ld whole burnt offerings on your altar.
Bless*ln all his skills, Lord,*s and*ld be pleased with the work of his hands. Strike*ln down those who rise against him, his*ld foes till they rise no more.”
About*p Benjamin he said: “Let*pn the beloved of the Lord*s rest secure in him, for*ld he shields him all day long, and*ld the one the Lord*s loves rests between his shoulders.”
About*p Joseph he said: “May*pn the Lord*s bless his land with*ld the precious dew from heaven above and*ld with the deep waters that lie below;
with*ln the best the sun brings forth and*ld the finest the moon can yield;
with*ln the choicest gifts of the ancient mountains and*ld the fruitfulness of the everlasting hills;

with*ln the best gifts of the earth and its fullness and*ld the favor of him who dwelt in the burning bush. Let*ln all these rest on the head of Joseph, on*ld the brow of the prince among his brothers.

In*ln majesty he is like a firstborn bull; his*ld horns are the horns of a wild ox. With*ln them he will gore the nations, even*ld those at the ends of the earth. Such*ln are the ten thousands of Ephraim; such*ld are the thousands of Manasseh.”
About*p Zebulun he said: “Rejoice,*pn Zebulun, in your going out, and*ld you, Issachar, in your tents.
They*ln will summon peoples to the mountain and*ld there offer the sacrifices of the righteous; they*ln will feast on the abundance of the seas, on*ld the treasures hidden in the sand.”
About*p Gad he said: “Blessed*pn is he who enlarges Gad’s domain! Gad*ld lives there like a lion, tearing*ld at arm or head.

He*ln chose the best land for himself; the*ld leader’s portion was kept for him. When*ln the heads of the people assembled, he*ld carried out the Lord’s*s righteous will, and*ld his judgments concerning Israel.”
About*p Dan he said: “Dan*pn is a lion’s cub, springing*ld out of Bashan.”
About*p Naphtali he said: “Naphtali*pn is abounding with the favor of the Lord*s and*ld is full of his blessing; he*ld will inherit southward to the lake.”
About*p Asher he said: “Most*pn blessed of sons is Asher; let*ld him be favored by his brothers, and*ld let him bathe his feet in oil.
The*ln bolts of your gates will be iron and bronze, and*ld your strength will equal your days.
“There*pn is no one like the God of Jeshurun, who*ld rides across the heavens to help you and*ld on the clouds in his majesty.
The*ln eternal God is your refuge, and*ld underneath are the everlasting arms. He*ln will drive out your enemies before you, saying,*ld ‘Destroy them!’
So*ln Israel will live in safety; Jacob*ld will dwell secure in*ln a land of grain and new wine, where*ld the heavens drop dew.

Blessed*ln are you, Israel! Who*ld is like you, a*ld people saved by the Lord?*s He*ln is your shield and helper and*ld your glorious sword. Your*ln enemies will cower before you, and*ld you will tread on their heights.”
